csf_subcategory_name: Policy for managing cybersecurity risks is established
Organizational leadership is responsible and accountable for cybersecurity risk
Risk management objectives are established and agreed to by stakeholders
Cybersecurity supply chain risk management program is established
Inventories of hardware managed by the organization are maintained
Inventories of software and systems are maintained
Assets are prioritized based on classification and criticality
Vulnerabilities in assets are identified and recorded
Threats and vulnerabilities inform risk prioritization
Identities and credentials are managed
Users and services are authenticated
Data-at-rest is protected
Data-in-transit is protected
Backups are created and tested
Networks are protected from unauthorized access
Networks and services are monitored for adverse events
Computing hardware and software are monitored for adverse events
Potentially adverse events are analyzed
Incidents are declared when criteria are met
Incident response plan is executed
Stakeholders are notified of incidents
Incidents are contained
Incidents are eradicated
Recovery plan is executed
Recovery progress is communicated to stakeholders
